intro: Heterotropa infrapurpurea, commonly known as the purple-veined heterotropa, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves with prominent purple veins. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a tubular corolla. Heterotropa infrapurpurea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
